name: Show NoFollow links (enhanced)
description:
Similar to other userstyles, this outlines rel="nofollow"'d links, however this also outlines all immediate children of the links. This is for the case when the a tag wraps a block level element and the outline is not shown, for example:

<a href="http://example.com" rel="nofollow">
  <h4>My header</h4>
</a>
additional_info:
In some cases you will get links that get double outlines around them. Due to the nature of css styles, there's no good way to get around that issue - but better to see the double outline than miss a link.

There is also a possibility of missing a link if someone has *two* wrapping inline tags around a block tag, but that seems like it would be rare.
